# Tree Removal Services Request for Standing Offer

**Government Tender Announcement**

## Project Overview

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is seeking vendors to provide Tree Removal Services on an "as and when requested" basis under a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA). Requirements will be completed at various locations on NCC lands within the National Capital Region in Ontario and Quebec.

## Background

The NCC is a federal Crown corporation established in 1959 under the National Capital Act. The organization provides value in the Capital Region by fulfilling three roles: long-term planning of federal lands, stewardship of nationally significant public places, and development and conservation.

## Objective

The objective of this Request for Standing Offers (RFSO) is to establish a Standing Offer Agreement with vendors who can provide Tree Removal Services as needed. Successful Contractors will enter into a formal NCC SOA, which will serve as the instrument for individual call-ups.

## Key Requirements

* Vendors must provide Tree Removal Services on an "as and when requested" basis.
* Requirements will be completed at various locations on NCC lands within the National Capital Region in Ontario and Quebec.
* A maximum of four SOAs will be awarded, active for four years or until total expenditure is reached.

## Trade Agreements

This procurement process is subject to trade agreements listed below:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
